title: Psychedelic Partners on the Path
text:
Hey, I'm glad you stopped to read my post. 

Where to start? Perhaps a bit about me. 
I'm 24, been in Seattle a couple months and the PNW my whole life. I've traveled to Europe, central America, and extensively throughout the US. Travel keeps me going, I can't get settled in the same place otherwise I start to lose it a bit, the thrill of the unknown and adventure always calls me back to the road. Next on my list is either the Amazon rainforest or southeast Asia, both of which are places which I feel would greatly benefit my spiritual growth. 

What is this 'spiritual' growth I speak of? Well, that's the thing. About two years ago I was introduced to psilocybin, and since then I have experienced LSD, DMT, and had numerous mind-altering, consciousness-expanding experiences. I have not taken any drugs in 6 months and have integrated much of the knowledge and information learned in those trips, but I have changed. I feel 'different' than most people my age, and though I'm an alpha, dominant male I no longer strive to 'conquer' and dominate those around me. Essentially, these drugs were the key for a spiritual awakening of which I now willingly follow the path. 

If you can relate to any of this at all, shoot me a message. I note practice yoga almost b daily, and love to get out in nature. I'm not looking for a lifetime partner right now, but kindred individuals who are willing to be vulnerable, honest, and open in relationships. I no longer play games or try to 'get ahead' in relationship, it only leads to pain and disappointment for those involved. What I can offer is my wholesome, undistracted masculine presence, with a promise to be honest and courageous as the man in the relationship. Perhaps, from that foundation, a magnificent flower can be nurtured and grow. 

Hope to hear from you soon

I find I generally connect best with those around my age and younger, and would consider someone anywhere between about 25-45, although for a really good match, a couple of years on either side wouldn't be an issue. title: Opening to the Divine Feminine
text:
Hello, thanks for checking out my post.

I'm a 22 year old student-athlete who's weakness is conscious, intriguing, deep, and sensual women. Believe it or not, I'm not ruled *entirely* by testosterone, my hobbies include hiking and camping, cooking, yoga, meaningful conversation, and essentially all fitness pursuits. If you're still intrigued, read on. 

I recently moved up to Seattle from Eugene, I'm a lifelong PNW resident. Over the past 18 months or so I have undergone an intense and very personal spiritual awakening, and I am still integrating many of the experiences and insights into my everyday life and character. Perhaps this is something you can relate with personally, perhaps not. If I lost you at 'spiritual', then by all means flip on over to the casual encounters page. 

I'm a very sexual being, but have matured to the point where I desire to form relationships with women that aren't based solely around sex. I am willing to challenge myself to be honest and transparent as a friend, companion, and lover, hope you are as well. I crave a deeper level of connection and intimacy, one which is free of deception, envy, or malice. Jealousy and anger will always be present in human relationships, but through communication and understanding we can always overcome these minor roadblocks. I am willing to continue to work on myself, and hope that my partner is as well. 

What am I looking for in a woman/relationship?

To be honest, I have no expectations. I'm still a youngin, but I like to think that I'm quite mature and aware for my age. I always push myself to live out of my comfort zone. I know that there is so much more to learn, and I'm eager to experience new things with people who push me to grow and evolve. Maybe you're one of those people, I'm excited to find out what makes you unique. 


Hope to hear from you, please include a picture in your response (I will reciprocate and be more open once 1-1 communication is established). Sorry to be a bit shallow, but you never can be too careful on craigslist.

Hope you're having a fantastic day

title: THE BREATH OF MY SOUL MATE.. WHERE ARE YOU?
text:
What kind of people are out there? How many will actually read this? How many actually value human lives and their relationships? 

Can your heart beat with mine? 

I see a lot of interesting ads here on Craigslist. People looking for the next big things whether that be an affair, a hook up, a relationship, or those who are looking for an ego boost and steal pictures.

About four years ago, I lost my partner of 12 years. Yes, we were really young when we got together; and yes, I just recently turned 32. He died honorably while serving this country. 

In the 12 years we were together I learned many things. I learned that a relationship is a risk. You don't need to get on 60 dates to know if someone is right for you. Why? Because you are going to spend the rest of your life getting to know someone. You know, it was after 4 years that I actually knew my husband's favorite color. People think they can have life figured out before they settle down, but that will never happen.

People these days are so picky that I guarantee they have missed out on many opportunities at love; yet, they will sit on social media and complain because they are alone. People are humans, and a human life is a beautiful thing no matter their age, color, weight, or their body. 
Love is seeing past flaws. We all have flaws and imperfections. From what I see on Craigslist, not too many people can see past flaws with all these laundry lists of credentials for someone to be able to contact them. 

Love sees no wrong. There were so many times my hubby did something foolish, but I always defended him to the ground. There were times when I was wrong, and I admitted it. There were times when I was right, but would just laugh and agree to disagree. 
We kept our personal life personal. When things went wrong we dealt with them as a team. We didn't post things on Facebook for people to butt in and give their opinion about something. 
There were times I wanted to run over than man with a damn bus, he was so ornery. But I would look into his eyes as they gleamed at me. You could see the depth of his love in his eyes. 

When we were engaged, we did just that. The rings may have been cheap, but we did it the right way. Changing your profile to engaged or married is not the same thing. 
I always tell people, "Just because it Shines -- It Doesn't Mean It's Gold!" Even the most physically attractive guys can be the worst candidates for someone to settle down with. 

Every night when we went to bed, I would lay may head on his chest and listen to him breathe. It was funny because we almost took the same identical breathes. 
Can love happen immediately? YES it can. Love happens when it happens. There are no rules to dating and falling for someone. 

I am not looking for someone to replace this great man. But I know, there is another great man who can walk this journey of life with me and breathe the breath of life together. Can your heart beat with mine? Who knows, and it doesn't have to. But wouldn't it be amazing to take that risk and find out?

If you want to text, you can email me your number and we can go from there!
So, can your heart beat with mine? Who wants to find out?

Hello, Internet!

I am a gender non-conforming, queer, polyamorous man. I enjoy most nerdy activities, such as board games, tabletop RPGs, video games, sci-fi and fantasy books and shows, and the occasional anime. I also enjoy drinking and watching crappy movies/anime. I care about justice in general, and social justice in particular. I sometimes write stories, make games, and record podcasts, though not yet with enough seriousness for any of that to actually be anywhere near publishing :P

Under optimal circumstances, I'm a somewhat even mix of homebody and adventurous. I particularly like going to parks and climbing trees, and I enjoy yoga for fitness. However, I am struggling with depression at the moment, so I don't have as much energy. I know that's not a great place to start, but unfortunately it's a very big part of my life that bears mentioning. I should also mention that I have social anxiety and borderline Asperger's, though I'm dealing with those fairly well (though they're still problematic, of course).

While I desire companionship, I find it difficult to maintain a consistent level of engagement and care for others (never mind myself). I am seeking someone who understands my predicament, who perhaps has struggles of their own, and who is interested in cautiously building an intimate connection of some kind.

I do not use my mental illnesses as excuses to treat people poorly, or to content myself with unhealthy relationships. Sometimes those things happen in spite of my intentions and due to my mental illnesses, but I do my best to fight such incidents and make up for them (not make excuses for them). Being kind is important to me. I am seeking someone who understands that.

I am pretty open to different kinds of relationships, or just seeing how things go. In particular, I don't have much opportunity for human contact in my life (largely due to the baggage of being socialized as a straight male), and would be happy to find someone who is seeking any kind of gentle touch. Otherwise, I'm just looking for a somewhat more intimate emotional connection than I have with my friends. Or a yoga buddy would be nice.

I hate to be picky, but I may as well be honest to save everyone time. So, please be:
* At most under 50; under 40 preferable
* Relatively self-sufficient and stable, or else self-aware of one's needs and instabilities so we can work with/around them (I'm definitely in that second camp)
* Not religious
* Not into sports (some interest is fine, but if it's a part of your identity, then that's definitely too much for me)

Also, my attraction to men is relatively new to me, and I am a bit skittish around people with traditionally masculine traits (both physical and social). I don't want to rule anyone out without even hearing them out, but if you're a beefy dude or if you can pass for a straight guy, then don't get your hopes up :\

Tell me a little bit about yourself in your introductory email, or else I'm likely to ignore it. What do you like to do? What are you passionate about?

title: I know you are out there, looking
text:
I know you are out there, somewhere, leading your life. Shopping, cooking, dropping the kids off at school, just living. In the quiet moments of your day you wonder how you got to where you are and why, feeling there has to be more, knowing someone is out there, looking for you. You feel the emptiness. You love your family but something is missing. Deep, deep in you innermost being is an ember. The nucleus of a flame, a flame you dream of burning bright. But, it just smolders in your day to day existence. You need that man, the one to tend to it, to add the fuel, carefully, gently, expertly, and to blow that dying ember into first a flicker of a flame, then a steady fire, and finally a passionate conflagration that consumes all the daily drudgery of life. 

It is fate that has brought you here. I have been searching for you for so long. A woman of depth, perception, intelligence, passion, romance. A woman to be friend, confidant, lover. Not wanting to change our lives but to add that missing piece, that spark, that connection, to form memories to last a lifetime. The adventure begins with just one email... 

FAQ 

Let me answer some commonly asked questions. Yes, these are real questions. If you have another question just send it on in and if it is a good one it might even make the list. 

Are you real? "I think therefore I am?" I think so. 

Are you ugly? No. I have all my hair and all my teeth. I've been described as cute and adorable. 

What are your "statistics?" What? Do you plan to put me on your fantasy football team? Whatever. 40, White, male, married, employed, 6' Brown and brown. 200 lbs. Drug and disease free. Hat size-I have no idea. Shoe size-varies with manufacturer. No tattoos or piercings. 

Do you have a problem with tattoos and piercings? Nope. But I don't have any because I'm afraid of needles. 

How big is your member? Yes, someone really asked this. I am not shallow or vain enough to measure it. Give me a break. It works fine for me and no one has ever complained. Yes, it is circumcised and shaved. And, no I don't have any pictures of it to send to you. What kind of narcissist do you think I am? 

Are you a "psycho?" Let me check with "the voices" and get back to you... 

Are you on the FBI's ten most wanted list? No, I am not wanted by the FBI, CIA, NSA, TSA, AMA, AAA, BSA, UNCLE, Control, MI-6, Interpol, or any other three letter agency. No arrests, no convictions, and no outstanding warrants. I don't even have any unpaid parking tickets. 

Are you kinky? I guess that depends on your definition of kinky. I mean, some people think woman-on-the-top and cunnilingus is kinky. I think of myself as adventurous and creative.On the other hand, if when you hear the word foreplay your first thought is cattle prod better move on. But, if you know the difference between the Liberator ramp and the wedge we'll get along just fine (Google it). And if you like wearing lingerie so much the better. 

Why don't you post a picture? Well, maybe I'm a vampire and I can't be photographed. How about discretion? Did you miss the part about my being married? Oh, I do have pictures. And I'll send a picture to you when I'm comfortable that I'm talking to a real woman that I'm attracted to. And you should have a picture too. You will have to reveal yourself at some point. But, nothing to fear, I am the soul of discretion. 

Why are you looking for a married woman? Why not a single one? An even playing field. I'm not planning to leave my marriage. A married woman who is in the same situation as I am is less likely to get over attached. A married woman will understand family duties, understand that we both have lives, and will respect our obligations and circumstances. She will savor and cherish the time we have together. 

How would you describe your ideal woman? Age 25-?. Under 5'6" in her bare feet, petite, weighs less than me, well-groomed, takes regular showers or baths (and may even enjoy sharing them). Speaks with her eyes, warm, caring, open, curious, creative, perceptive, has a sense of humor. She is just fun to be with. And accepting, the kind of woman you can share anything, hopes and dreams, fears and failures. Someone who has experienced life and is mature. She's not afraid to be herself. She is multifaceted, a precious diamond, but has some facets that she needs to share that cannot be seen or appreciated by others. Discreet. 


I would like to meet a Asian, Chinese, Japanese, Filipino, Thai, Korean, Vietnamese, etc. I am however open to all race. 

So looks are important? Of course. 


Why don't you find a woman at work? I like my job. Yes there are women at work I'd love to be with, but these days even hinting at something will get you a pink slip. I like my job. Now, if that babe from work stumbles on this ad...But what are the odds of that? 

Why don't you pick up someone at a bar? I really don't enjoy the bar scene. And, anyone I meet a a bar would assume I'm single and I don't want to start something under false pretenses. 

Why didn't you write to my ad? Been there, done that. Frankly, 99% of the ads are fake placed by spammers or else from some other site that just wants a credit card number to "check out the profile." I don't even bother looking anymore. 

Why didn't you respond to my email? I like to respond to all emails. I think it is only polite to respond to any woman who takes the time to write. There are only three types of email I don't respond to: Spammers, men, and someone who wants to have a debate about my ethics. I think I've gotten pretty good at recognizing the spammers. If you are male let me state loud and clear that I am a heterosexual. No, I'm not homophobic, just totally enchanted with and captivated by women. If you are one of the morally outraged then just keep it to yourself. You don't know my life or situation and it has nothing to do with you. Now if I didn't respond to you and you are not in any of these categories then either your message looked like spam or your message got lost. Please try again. 

Are you on drugs? Do the Viagra and Cialis count? Just joking. No. I have never used drugs. 

Do you practice safe sex? Absolutely. 

Is your wife attractive? Can we do a threesome? Sorry, unfortunately she's not that adventurous. 

Why don't you just hire a professional? Because that is illegal. Duh. And, you can't have a friendship with a professional. And if you are a professional (that is a fee for service woman) I don't want to hear from you. Add that to my list of types of email I don't respond to. 

Are you really looking for just one woman? Yes. I want someone who is also looking for a regular steady friend and not just a one night stand. 

Do you have references? You have got to be kidding. I don't kiss and tell. 

Are you good in bed? If you only knew. 

Do you have a job? Yes. 

With your career and life how will you have time for me? You can always make time for the people and things that are important. 

When are you available? The best time for me is during the week in the morning or afternoon. 

Have you found someone yet? If you are reading this, no. Once I do this ad will be gone. 

Why did you write so much? Because I'm not looking for just anyone so I'm being very specific. Now one women wrote to tell me I shouldn't write all this and that I should be more mysterious. Oh, let me assure you, there is plenty of mystery and excitement to come for that one exceptional woman. 

Did you really write this? Every word. And this is only the tip of the iceberg. 

Could you share some of your erotica with me? Sure, all you have to do is ask. But don't be surprised if you find yourself wanting more. 

* 

Now you've read all the way through. So why haven't you written yet? What have you got to lose? Get an anonymous email and write. If I bore you just delete it and go on with your life. But, imagine if, years from now, you look back at so many wonderful memories and you are so thankful that you took the chance. Everything to gain, nothing to lose.

title: LETS HAVE AN AMAZING WEEKEND!!
text:
Can your heart beat with mine? 
I see a lot of interesting ads here on Craigslist. People looking for the next big things whether that be an affair, a hook up, a relationship, or those who are looking for an ego boost and steal pictures.

About four years ago, I lost my partner of 12 years. Yes, we were really young when we got together; and yes, I just recently turned 32. He died honorably while serving this country. 

In the 12 years we were together I learned many things. I learned that a relationship is a risk. You don't need to get on 60 dates to know if someone is right for you. Why? Because you are going to spend the rest of your life getting to know someone. You know, it was after 4 years that I actually knew my husband's favorite color. People think they can have life figured out before they settle down, but that will never happen.

People these days are so picky that I guarantee they have missed out on many opportunities at love; yet, they will sit on social media and complain because they are alone. People are humans, and a human life is a beautiful thing no matter their age, color, weight, or their body. 
Love is seeing past flaws. We all have flaws and imperfections. From what I see on Craigslist, not too many people can see past flaws with all these laundry lists of credentials for someone to be able to contact them. 

Love sees no wrong. There were so many times my hubby did something foolish, but I always defended him to the ground. There were times when I was wrong, and I admitted it. There were times when I was right, but would just laugh and agree to disagree. 
We kept our personal life personal. When things went wrong we dealt with them as a team. We didn't post things on Facebook for people to butt in and give their opinion about something. 
There were times I wanted to run over than man with a damn bus, he was so ornery. But I would look into his eyes as they gleamed at me. You could see the depth of his love in his eyes. 

When we were engaged, we did just that. The rings may have been cheap, but we did it the right way. Changing your profile to engaged or married is not the same thing. 
I always tell people, "Just because it Shines -- It Doesn't Mean It's Gold!" Even the most physically attractive guys can be the worst candidates for someone to settle down with. 

Every night when we went to bed, I would lay may head on his chest and listen to him breathe. It was funny because we almost took the same identical breathes. 
Can love happen immediately? YES it can. Love happens when it happens. There are no rules to dating and falling for someone. 

I am not looking for someone to replace this great man. But I know, there is another great man who can walk this journey of life with me and breathe the breath of life together. Can your heart beat with mine? Who knows, and it doesn't have to. But wouldn't it be amazing to take that risk and find out?

title: Looking for a friend
text:
I'm really nervous about posting in a place like this, but less than using a dating site or something like that. I'm a male-to-female transsexual who transitioned years ago. I've been on hormone therapy for almost a decade and have been living as myself for about half of that. I've never had any surgery of any sort. I'm a natural c-cup, but that's irrelevant I suppose. I'm a very liberal atheist and I've dealt with religious persecution in the past so I don't really take kindly to those that push their religion on others. I'm also basically a virgin (pretty much the opposite of the 'trans prostitute' stereotype), so I'm 100% clean and all that. I don't smoke either. Not cigarettes or weed. I'm not much of a drinker either, but I will drink socially. Not enough to get blackout drunk or anything dumb like that. Now that all the technical stuff is out of the way...

I'm about 5' 9", auburn hair, green/hazel eyes, and I'm looking for a friend to spend my day to day with. A boyfriend if it comes to that, but a friend is most important. I'm somewhat new-ish to the area and I don't really know a lot of people outside of a small group of people I know. I'm a big gamer and internet dweller, and finding someone with my specific interest there has been a little hard. Finding one that's ok with me when they find out I'm trans has proven impossible. 

I want someone who isn't a total slob, isn't some sex-crazed perv who fetishises people like me, and would treat me like they would any other girl they know. I live an otherwise normal life as a normal (albeit nerdy) girl and don't project my little birth defect in my day to day life. Being transgender isn't a defining feature, but rather, a caveat in the list of things I happen to be. I'm also a gamer. A writer. A retro gaming history buff. A level 60 bard on Final Fantasy XIV. I just happen to have the wrong junk, for now anyway. I don't live as what stereotypes would define a trans woman should. I'm just a normal woman with a slight problem that I've mostly overcome. Nothing more.

I have queer friends but I don't make a point to hang out with specifically queer groups or anything like that. I'm not a prostitute either, so please don't bother me with requests like that because I won't respond to them. I'm looking for a friend first and a lover second. If I can't get one, then the other simply isn't worth having. That said though, I'd love to have someone to be with. It's a little hard to admit, but I'm pretty lonely on that front. Otherwise I wouldn't be posting in this wretched hive of scum and villainy. (I loved the new movie, btw).

If you're interested in getting to know me better, please shoot me an email back. A picture is always nice, and if I think it's alright to, I'll respond with one of my own. I'm ok with anyone 25-35 or so, depending on how well we click and all. Again, even if nothing comes up between us, just having an irl gaming friend on my level would be nice. All I ask is that you keep the trans thing between us, ok?

I try to treat my friends better than most people treat their romantic partners.

I'm well-read and well-educated and know at least a little bit about a lot of things. I keep up with political and socioeconomic issues. I take the time to read the perspectives of marginalized people, and volunteer my time for their protection. I put a lot of work into being a good person, and while I don't always succeed to my own or others' satisfaction, whenever I fail I learn something new that I can apply next time.

I like to read novels, play with cats, have deep and interesting conversations with people, and to spend time outside when the weather's nice (the specific activity doesn't really matter, as long as I'm doing it with someone whose company I enjoy). My educational background is in math/science/programming, so I can often be distracted by interesting logic problems and the like. You should also be patient! It will take a little time for us to get acquainted and get comfortable with each other before anything happens. It takes some time for me to trust someone new, and I've found that the best way to forge a relationship doesn't start with an awkward coffee date or getting a drink at a bar. It takes a certain amount of familiarity, but once I choose to trust you, I'm a warm, caring person who puts everything into my relationships with other people. I try to treat my friends better than most people treat their romantic partners.

I'm well-read and well-educated and know at least a little bit about a lot of things. I keep up with political and socioeconomic issues. I take the time to read the perspectives of marginalized people and volunteer my time for their protection. I put a lot of work into being a good person, and while I don't always succeed to my own or others' satisfaction, whenever I fail I learn something that I can apply next time.

I like to read novels, play with cats, have deep and interesting conversations with people, and to spend time outside when the weather's nice. (The specific activity doesn't really matter, as long as I'm doing it with someone whose company I enjoy.) My educational background is in math/science/programming, so I can often be distracted by interesting logic problems and the like.
